channel.title: psql on The Art of PostgreSQL
channel.description: Recent content in psql on The Art of PostgreSQL

item.title: Postgres Connection Strings and psql
item.description:
PostgreSQL connection strings embedded in your application can take two different forms: the key-value notation or the postgresql:// URI scheme. When it comes to using psql though, another form of connection string is introduced, with command line options -h -p -U and environment variable support.

In this short article you will learn that you can use either of the three different forms in psql and thus easily copy & paste you application connection string right at the console to test it!

item.title: Setting up psql, the PostgreSQL CLI
item.description: PostgreSQL ships with an interactive console with the command line tool named psql. It can be used both for scripting and interactive usage and is moreover quite a powerful tool. Interactive features includes autocompletion, readline support (history searches, modern keyboard movements, etc), input and output redirection, formatted output, and more.
